war.content: The Rashidun Caliphate defeats the Sasanian Empire at the Battle of al-Qādisiyyah in Iraq

general.content: Beethoven's only opera, Fidelio, premieres in Vienna

america.content: Occupation of Alcatraz: Native American activists seize control of Alcatraz Island until being ousted by the U.S. Government on June 11, 1971

general.content: Thomas Edison announces his invention of the phonograph, a machine that can record and play sound

america.content: The "La Ronde" opens in Honolulu, first revolving restaurant in the United States

war.content: American Civil War: Confederate President Jefferson Davis appoints Judah Benjamin Secretary of War

general.content: In Britain's worst mountaineering tragedy, the Cairngorm Plateau Disaster, five children and one of their leaders are found dead from exposure in the Scottish mountains

war.content: The Soviet Union launches RDS-37, a 1.6 megaton two stage hydrogen bomb designed by Andrei Sakharov. The bomb was dropped over Semipalatinsk

general.content: Thespis of Icaria becomes the first recorded actor to portray a character on stage

america.content: Warren G. Harding, 29th President, signs the Willis–Campbell Act into law, prohibiting doctors from prescribing beer or liquor for medicinal purposes

general.content: British naturalist Charles Darwin's On the Origin of Species is published

america.content: In Washington, D.C., the FBI Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory (better known as the FBI Crime Lab) officially opens

general.content: The White Ship sinks in the English Channel, drowning William Adelin, son and heir of Henry I of England

war.content: Servius Tullius, king of Rome, celebrates the first of his three triumphs for his victory over the Etruscans

general.content: An unidentified hijacker named Vrillon, takes over Britain's Southern Television for six minutes, starting at 5:12 pm

america.content: A national Thanksgiving Day is observed in the United States as proclaimed by President George Washington at the request of Congress

war.content: Ukrainian War of Independence: The Red Army launches a surprise attack against the Makhnovshchina

general.content: At the Swedish–Norwegian Club in Paris, Alfred Nobel signs his last will and testament, setting aside his estate to establish the Nobel Prize

america.content: In New York City, the first Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade is held

war.content: World War II: RAF Fauld explosion: An explosion at a Royal Air Force ammunition dump in Staffordshire kills seventy people

america.content: The Grand Ole Opry begins broadcasting in Nashville, Tennessee, as the WSM Barn Dance

general.content: Atari releases Pong, the first commercially successful video game

america.content: U.S. Admiral Richard E. Byrd leads the first expedition to fly over the South Pole

war.content: The Tang dynasty scores a decisive victory over their rival Xue Rengao at the Battle of Qianshuiyuan

general.content: Exxon and Mobil sign a US$73.7 billion agreement to merge, thus creating ExxonMobil, the world's largest company

america.content: The AI chatbot ChatGPT is launched by OpenAI

war.content: Great Northern War: King Charles XII of Sweden dies during a siege of the fortress of Fredriksten in Norway

general.content: World AIDS Day is proclaimed worldwide by the UN member states

america.content: Shaw University, the first historically black university in the southern United States, is founded in Raleigh, North Carolina

war.content: World War II: Emperor Hirohito of Japan gives his tacit approval to the decision of the imperial council to initiate war against the United States

general.content: Swedish parliament approves the Swedish Freedom of the Press Act and implements it as a ground law; making Sweden the first in the world with freedom of speech

america.content: Dedication of the Touro Synagogue, in Newport, Rhode Island, the first synagogue in what will become the United States

war.content: World War II: During the Manhattan Project, a team led by Enrico Fermi initiates the first artificial self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction

general.content: Modern neon lighting is first demonstrated by Georges Claude at the Paris Motor Show

america.content: Illinois becomes the 21st U.S. state

war.content: American Revolutionary War: USS Alfred becomes the first vessel to fly the Grand Union Flag (the precursor to the Stars and Stripes)

general.content: Alpha Phi Alpha, the first intercollegiate Greek-lettered fraternity for African-Americans, was founded at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York

america.content: Thirty-eight colonists arrive at Berkeley Hundred, Virginia. The group's charter proclaims that the day "be yearly and perpetually kept holy as a day of thanksgiving to Almighty God"

america.content: The Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, repealing Prohibition (which was instated in the Eighteenth amendment)

war.content: World War II: Great Britain declares war on Finland, Hungary and Romania

general.content: London becomes the world's first city to host licensed taxicabs

america.content: The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia

general.content: World War II: The Imperial Japanese Navy carries out a surprise attack on the United States Pacific Fleet and its defending Army and Marine air forces at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii

america.content: Apollo 17, the last Apollo Moon mission, is launched. The crew takes the photograph known as The Blue Marble as they leave the Earth

war.content: World War I: The United States declares war on Austria-Hungary

general.content: First confirmed case of COVID-19 in China

america.content: John Lennon is murdered by Mark David Chapman in front of The Dakota in New York City

war.content: World War II: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt declares December 7 to be "a date which will live in infamy" after which the U.S. declares war on Japan

war.content: World War II: China, Cuba, Guatemala, and the Philippine Commonwealth declare war on Germany and Japan

general.content: The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica is published

america.content: U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt is awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in the mediation of the Russo-Japanese War

war.content: Spanish–American War: The Treaty of Paris is signed, officially ending the conflict

general.content: Apollo 17 becomes the sixth and final Apollo mission to land on the Moon

america.content: Indiana becomes the 19th U.S. state

general.content: The United States Supreme Court releases its decision in Bush v. Gore

america.content: Pennsylvania becomes the second state to ratify the US Constitution

war.content: Adolf Hitler declares the imminent extermination of the Jews at a meeting in the Reich Chancellery

general.content: Sir Francis Drake sets sail from Plymouth, England, on his round-the-world voyage

america.content: The Plymouth Colony establishes the system of trial by 12-men jury in the American colonies

america.content: Alabama becomes the 22nd U.S. state

war.content: The Soviet Union is expelled from the League of Nations for invading Finland

general.content: The American Psychiatric Association unamiously decides to remove homosexuality from its official list of psychiatric disorders

america.content: Gone with the Wind, the highest inflation adjusted grossing film, receives its premiere at Loew's Grand Theatre in Atlanta, Georgia, United States

war.content: Hunkpapa Lakota leader Sitting Bull is killed on Standing Rock Indian Reservation, leading to the Wounded Knee Massacre

general.content: Most Recent Eruption of Mount Fuji

america.content: Members of the Sons of Liberty disguised as Mohawk Indians dump hundreds of crates of tea into Boston harbor as a protest against the Tea Act

war.content: The Battle of the Bulge begins with the surprise offensive of three German armies through the Ardennes forest

general.content: The first account of a blood transfusion is published, in the form of a letter from physician Richard Lower to chemist Robert Boyle

america.content: France formally recognizes the United States

war.content: General Ulysses S. Grant issues General Order No. 11, expelling Jews from parts of Tennessee, Mississippi, and Kentucky

general.content: The United States House of Representatives impeaches Donald Trump for the first time

america.content: US Secretary of State William Seward proclaims the adoption of the Thirteenth Amendment, prohibiting slavery throughout the United States

general.content: BBC World Service begins broadcasting as the BBC Empire Service

america.content: President Bill Clinton is impeached by the United States House of Representatives, becoming the second president of the United States to be impeached

war.content: Start of the First Indochina War

general.content: The United States Space Force becomes the first new branch of the United States Armed Forces since 1947

america.content: The Louisiana Purchase is completed at a ceremony in New Orleans

war.content: The National Liberation Front of South Vietnam, popularly known as the Viet Cong, is formally established in Tân Lập village

general.content: Apollo 8 is launched from the Kennedy Space Center, placing its crew on a lunar trajectory for the first visit to another celestial body by humans

america.content: William Bradford and the Mayflower Pilgrims land near what is now known as Plymouth Rock in Plymouth, Massachusetts

war.content: Egyptian forces decisively defeat Ottoman troops at the Battle of Konya

general.content: In the United Kingdom, a 70 miles per hour (110 km/h) speed limit is applied to all rural roads including motorways for the first time

general.content: The transistor is first demonstrated at Bell Laboratories

war.content: World War I: The "Christmas truce" begins

general.content: Halley's Comet is sighted by Johann Georg Palitzsch, confirming Edmund Halley's prediction of its passage. This was the first passage of a comet predicted ahead of time

america.content: United States President Andrew Johnson grants an unconditional pardon to all Confederate veterans

war.content: A series of unofficial truces occur across the Western Front to celebrate Christmas

general.content: Marie and Pierre Curie announce the isolation of radium

america.content: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs a bill establishing the fourth Thursday in November as Thanksgiving Day in the United States
